Elang API to CouchDb

eCouch is an application that provides an API to a CouchDb server It uses the rfc4627 module from LShift The design was inspired in the article Building a Non-blocking TCP server using OTP principles and assumes that inets application is running.

Description

Elang API to CouchDb

eCouch is an application that provides an API to a CouchDb server It uses the rfc4627 module from LShift The design was inspired in the article Building a Non-blocking TCP server using OTP principles and assumes that inets application is running. todo: Accept a list of servers and implement load distribution algorithms

start/2

start(Type::_Type, StartArgs::startargs()) -> {ok, Pid} | {ok, Pid, State} | {error, Reason}

This function is called whenever an application is started using application:start/1,2, and should start the processes of the application. If the application is structured according to the OTP design principles as a supervision tree, this means starting the top supervisor of the tree.

stop/1

stop(State) -> void()

This function is called whenever an application has stopped. It is intended to be the opposite of Module:start/2 and should do any necessary cleaning up. The return value is ignored.
